text: The dining room at a camp has two sizes of tables. A large table seats ten people, and a small table seats eight people. When the campers come for dinner one night, there are four pizzas on each large table and three pizzas on each small table. The campers at each table share the pizzas equally.
• Does a person sitting at a small table get the same amount of pizza as a person sitting at a large table? Explain your reasoning and conclusion.
